intro: Hibbertia echiifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Hibbertia echiifolia is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Its unique morphology makes it a notable species in ecological and botanical studies.
